Anthony Scillia aka "Tony Mangia" (b. July 10 1982 in
Hackensack, New Jersey ) is a radio and television personality. Anthony was raised in his father's hometown of
Lodi, New Jersey , a town that was made up of predominately Italian-Americans.
Radio
Anthony "Tony Mangia" Scillia is most recently known for his radio show on "Brave New Radio"
WPSC-FM (88.7 FM, Wayne, NJ), The Tony Mangia Show - Radio: Italian Style. It is the only positive Italian/Italian-American themed show to be broadcast from New Jersey. The show feeds off of Anthony’s love of his Italian culture and heritage. He plays a wide variety of Italian and Italian-American music from many genres, old and new. The show airs live every Sunday from 3 PM-6 PM.
Anthony has featured numerous guests on the show, including:
Chef & TV Personality Lidia Mattichio Bastianich
Tony Award Winner & former lead in the Broadway musical Jersey Boys John Lloyd Young
Singer/Songwriter/Actor Frank Stallone
Official Bobby Darin Archivist Jimmy Scalia
Bobby Darin's Personal Manager Steve "Boom Boom" Blauner
Italian singer Giada Valenti
Sicilian Folk Singer Michela Musolino
Singer/Songwriter Joe Pagetta
Italian-American Singer/Songwriter Maristella
Singer/acoustic guitarist Anthony Fiumano
Comedian Mike Marino
Singer Bobby Valli
Poet Salvatore Amico Buttaci
Award-winng author Paul Salsini
Olive Oil Aficionado Johnny DeCarlo
Actor Gaetano Iacono (co-Star of Doughboys)
Musician/Comedian/Entertainer Larry Cutrone
Filmmaker Stephanie Foerster ( Watch The Pallino)
The show has been airing live since October 2006.
Anthony was awarded with the 2007 Maltese Award Winner for Outstanding New On-Air Personality. He most recently received WPSC's September 2007 DJ of the Month.
Anthony also hosted Mangia In The Morning, which was a Classic/Garage/Jersey Rock show that aired from October 2006 to September 2007.
Lodi Late Nite
Anthony was co-creator and host of Lodi Late Nite, which was a cult classic Public Access Show that aired from December 1999 until September 2000. The show followed a similar format to that of David Letterman. Richard Moschella was co-creator and co-host. Louis Jasmine was co-creator. The show also had such recurrent guests as Artie Magliannico, Johnny Paparazzi and the one and only Andy Martin (Lounge Singer Extraordinaire & Secret Member of the
Rat Pack
).
Independent Variety Showcaze
Anthony also created and hosted Independent Variety Showcaze (2004-2005). The Showcaze, as it was called, was a Public Access Show that featured people, places and events within North Jersey. The Showcaze’s guests included Kevin Knight & Camp IWF Wrestling School, psychic Jane Doherty, make-up artist Jeremy Selenfriend and Johnny De Carlo (Olive Oil Aficionado and Importer of Italian goods) to name a few.
Film
Anthony has also directed 3 short student films including To Each His Own (2002), Silence is Golden (2002) and Willow Creek (2005). He has also written a short script entitled Bocce'' which has won GIAA's (Guild of Italian-American Actors) Film Fest's Italian-American Heritage Award.
